<The Tension Builds>

<setup: tense confrontation in a dim room>
<speaker>: "He was rude to my family!"  
<speaker>: "You drove him out, right?"  
<speaker>: "He wanted to prove Sofya's guilt!"  

---
<setup: Raskolnikov's determined expression, audience captivated>
<speaker>: "He aimed to ruin my family!"  
<speaker>: "He thought he could win back favor!"  
<speaker>: "But he underestimated my love for Sofya!"

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov argues that Luzhin's motives are driven by spite and a desire to protect his own interests at the expense of others.
